00030 from xml.parsers import expat

00032 import sys

00035 from SearchWidgetFactory import *

00043 class SearchFormContainer( QWidget ):
00044         def __init__(self, parent):
00045                 QWidget.__init__( self, parent )
00046                 layout = QGridLayout( self )
00047                 layout.setSpacing( 0 )
00048                 layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00049                 # Maximum number of columns
00050                 self.col = 4
00051                 self.x = 0
00052                 self.y = 0
00053 
00054         def addWidget(self, widget, name=None):
00055                 if self.x + 1 > self.col:
00056                         self.x = 0
00057                         self.y = self.y + 1
00058 
00059                 # Add gridLine attribute to all widgets so we can easily discover
00060                 # in which line they are.
00061                 widget.gridLine = self.y
00062                 if name:
00063                         label = QLabel( name )
00064                         label.gridLine = self.y
00065                         vbox = QVBoxLayout()
00066                         vbox.setSpacing( 0 )
00067                         vbox.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00068                         vbox.addWidget( label, 0 )
00069                         vbox.addWidget( widget )
00070                         self.layout().addLayout( vbox, self.y, self.x )
00071                 else:
00072                         self.layout().addWidget( widget, self.y, self.x )
00073                 self.x = self.x + 1
00074 
00075 class SearchFormParser(object):
00076         def __init__(self, container, fields, model=''):
00077                 self.fields = fields
00078                 self.container = container
00079                 self.model = model
00080                 self.focusable = None
00081                 self.widgets = {}
00082 
00083         def _psr_start(self, name, attrs):
00084                 if name in ('form','tree','svg'):
00085                         self.title = attrs.get('string','Form')
00086                 elif name=='field':
00087                         select = attrs.get('select', False) or self.fields[attrs['name']].get('select', False)
00088                         if select:
00089                                 name = attrs['name']
00090                                 self.fields[name].update( attrs )
00091                                 self.fields[name]['model'] = self.model
00092 
00093                                 select = str(select)
00094                                 if select in self.widgets:
00095                                         self.widgets[ select ].append( name )
00096                                 else:
00097                                         self.widgets[ select ] = [ name ]
00098 
00099         def _psr_end(self, name):
00100                 pass
00101         def _psr_char(self, char):
00102                 pass
00103         def parse(self, xml_data):
00104                 psr = expat.ParserCreate()
00105                 psr.StartElementHandler = self._psr_start
00106                 psr.EndElementHandler = self._psr_end
00107                 psr.CharacterDataHandler = self._psr_char
00108                 self.widgetDict={}
00109                 psr.Parse(xml_data.encode('utf-8'))
00110 
00111                 for line in sorted( self.widgets.keys() ):
00112                         for name in self.widgets[ line ]:
00113                                 attributes = self.fields[name]
00114                                 type = attributes.get('widget', attributes['type'])
00115                                 widget = SearchWidgetFactory.create( type, name, self.container, attributes )
00116                                 if not widget:
00117                                         continue
00118                                 self.widgetDict[str(name)] = widget
00119                                 if 'string' in attributes:
00120                                         label = attributes['string']+' :'
00121                                 else:
00122                                         label = None
00123                                 self.container.addWidget( widget, label )
00124                                 if not self.focusable:
00125                                         self.focusable = widget
00126                 return self.widgetDict
00127 
00128 (SearchFormWidgetUi, SearchFormWidgetBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('searchform.ui') )
00129 
00130 ## @brief This class provides a form with the fields to search given a model.
00131 #
00132 # This class will emit the 'search()' signal each time the user pushes the 'search' button.
00133 # Then you can use the 'value()' function to obtain a domain-like list.
00134 class SearchFormWidget(AbstractSearchWidget, SearchFormWidgetUi):
00135         ## @brief Constructs a new SearchFormWidget.
00136         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00137                 AbstractSearchWidget.__init__(self, '', parent)
00138                 SearchFormWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00139                 self.setupUi( self )
00140                 
00141                 self.model = None
00142                 self.widgets = {}
00143                 self.name = ''
00144                 self.focusable = True
00145                 self.expanded = True
00146                 self._loaded = False
00147 
00148                 self.connect( self.pushExpander, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.toggleExpansion )
00149                 self.connect( self.pushClear, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.clear )
00150                 self.connect( self.pushSearch, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.search )
00151 
00152                 self.pushExpander.setEnabled( False )
00153                 self.pushClear.setEnabled( False )
00154                 self.pushSearch.setEnabled( False )
00155 
00156         ## @brief Returns True if it's been already loaded. That is: setup has been called.
00157         def isLoaded(self):
00158                 return self._loaded
00159 
00160         ## @brief Returns True if it has no widgets.
00161         def isEmpty(self):
00162                 if len(self.widgets):
00163                         return False
00164                 else:
00165                         return True
00166 
00167         ## @brief Initializes the widget with the appropiate widgets to search.
00168         #
00169         # Needed fields include XML view (usually 'form'), fields dictionary with information
00170         # such as names and types, and the model parameter.
00171         def setup(self, xml, fields, model):
00172                 # We allow one setup call only
00173                 if self._loaded:
00174                         return 
00175 
00176                 self._loaded = True
00177                 self.pushExpander.setEnabled( True )
00178                 self.pushClear.setEnabled( True )
00179                 self.pushSearch.setEnabled( True )
00180 
00181                 parser = SearchFormParser(self.uiContainer, fields, model)
00182                 self.model = model
00183 
00184                 self.widgets = parser.parse(xml)
00185                 for widget in self.widgets.values():
00186                         self.connect( widget, SIGNAL('keyDownPressed()'), self, SIGNAL('keyDownPressed()') )
00187 
00188                 # Don't show expander button unless there are widgets in the
00189                 # second row
00190                 self.pushExpander.hide()
00191                 for x in self.widgets.values():
00192                         if x.gridLine > 0:
00193                                 self.pushExpander.show()
00194                                 break
00195 
00196                 self.name = parser.title
00197                 self.focusable = parser.focusable
00198                 self.expanded = True
00199                 self.toggleExpansion()
00200                 return 
00201 
00202         def keyPressEvent(self, event):
00203                 if event.key() in ( Qt.Key_Return, Qt.Key_Enter ):
00204                         self.search()
00205 
00206         def search(self):
00207                 self.emit( SIGNAL('search()') )
00208 
00209         ## @brief Shows Search and Clear buttons.
00210         def showButtons(self):
00211                 self.pushClear.setVisible( True )
00212                 self.pushSearch.setVisible( True )
00213 
00214         ## @brief Hides Search and Clear buttons.
00215         def hideButtons(self):
00216                 self.pushClear.setVisible( False )
00217                 self.pushSearch.setVisible( False )
00218 
00219         def toggleExpansion(self):
00220                 layout = self.uiContainer.layout()
00221                 
00222                 childs = self.uiContainer.children()
00223                 for x in childs:
00224                         if x.isWidgetType() and x.gridLine > 0:
00225                                 if self.expanded:
00226                                         x.hide()
00227                                 else:
00228                                         x.show()
00229                 self.expanded = not self.expanded
00230                 if self.expanded:
00231                         self.pushExpander.setIcon( QIcon(':/images/up.png') )
00232                 else:
00233                         self.pushExpander.setIcon( QIcon(':/images/down.png') )
00234                 
00235         def setFocus(self):
00236                 if self.focusable:
00237                         self.focusable.setFocus()
00238                 else:
00239                         QWidget.setFocus(self)
00240 
00241         ## @brief Clears all search fields.
00242         #
00243         # Calling 'value()' after this function should return an empty list.
00244         def clear(self):
00245                 for x in self.widgets.values():
00246                         x.clear()
00247 
00248         ## @brief Returns a domain-like list for the current search parameters.
00249         #
00250         # Note you can optionally give a 'domain' parameter which will be added to
00251         # the filters the widget will return.
00252         def value(self, domain=[]):
00253                 res = []
00254                 for x in self.widgets:
00255                         res += self.widgets[x].value()
00256                 v_keys = [x[0] for x in res]
00257                 for f in domain:
00258                         if f[0] not in v_keys:
00259                                 res.append(f)
00260                 return res
00261 
00262         ## @brief Allows setting filter values for all fields in the form.
00263         #
00264         # 'val' parameter should be a dictionary with field names as keys and
00265         # field values as values. Example:
00266         #
00267         # form.setValue({
00268         #       'name': 'enterprise',
00269         #       'income': 24
00270         # })
00271         def setValue(self, val):
00272                 for x in val:
00273                         if x in self.widgets:
00274                                 self.widgets[x].value = val[x]
